units.title: Detachment of hPSCs with Accutase
units.text: RC17, H9, and HS1001 hPSCs were detached from the culture dish with 0.5 mM Accutase (Thermo Fisher Scientiﬁc, #A1110501) to yield a single cell
units.rationale: Describes the enzymatic dissociation step to obtain single cells for organoid formation.

units.title: Preparation of FN‑silk/LN‑111 mixture
units.text:
final concentration of 10 μg ml−1. The FN-silk/LN-111 mixture was incubated
Both conventional and silk-VM organoids were fixed in 4% paraformaldehyde for 5 h at 4 °C
units.rationale: Specifies the concentration and incubation of the silk‑laminin mixture used as scaffold.

units.title: DAB immunohistochemistry staining
units.text: For diaminobenzidine (DAB) staining, the sections were incubated with secondary biotinylated horse antibodies diluted (1:200, Vector Laboratories) for 1 h at room temperature (RT), washed three times, and then incubated with avidin-biotin complex (ABC) for 1 h
units.rationale: Details the secondary antibody and ABC incubation steps for DAB detection.

units.title: Neuromelanin detection with Masson Fontana stain
units.text: After development of DAB staining, the sections were placed in an ammoniacal silver solution to detect neuromelanin using a Masson Fontana Stain Kit (Atom Scientiﬁc, #RRSK12-
units.rationale: Describes the post‑DAB silver staining used to visualize neuromelanin.

units.title: Whole‑cell patch‑clamp electrophysiology
units.text: Cells with neuronal morphology and round cell body were selected for recordings. Resting-membrane potentials were monitored immediately after breaking-in in current-clamp mode. Thereafter, cells were kept at a membrane potential of −60 mV to −80 mV, and 500 ms currents were injected from −85 pA to +165 pA with 20 pA increments to induce action potentials.
units.rationale: Outlines the recording configuration and stimulus protocol for electrophysiological measurements.

units.title: Calcium imaging of MAP2‑GCamP5 neurons
units.text: Calcium imaging of MAP2–GCamP5-labeled neurons. Calcium imaging was performed at day 120 of VM cultures containing the MAP2‐GCamP5 reporter. Images were captured on an inverted Ti2 microscope (Nikon) equipped with a CSU‑W1 spinning‑disc system, a sCMOS camera (Andor Neo) and 20× objective. An environment control chamber was used to maintain the temperature at 37 °C and CO2 level at 5% during imaging.
units.rationale: Specifies the microscope setup and environmental conditions for live calcium imaging.

units.title: Single‑cell 3′ library preparation and sequencing
units.text: Chromium Single Cell 3′ Library to generate single cell gel beads in emulsion (GEMs, version 3 chemistry). The resulting libraries were sequenced on a NextSeq500 or a NovaSeq 6000 with the following specifications Read1 28
units.rationale: Summarizes the 10x Genomics workflow and sequencing platform used for single‑cell transcriptomics.

units.title: Image acquisition and processing
units.text: Images were captured using an Epson Perfection V850 PRO flatbed scanner, or a Leica DMI6000B wide‑field microscope, or a Leica TCS SP8 confocal laser‑scanning microscope, or a Nikon inverted Ti2 microscope equipped with a CSU‑W1 spinning‑disc system. Image acquisition software was Leica LAS X and images were processed using Volocity 6.5.1 software (Quorum Technologies).
units.rationale: Lists the imaging instruments and software employed for data collection and analysis.
